Adventure Part 1: The Adventure Begins.name: 冒险第一部分：开启冒险
Adventure Part 1: The Adventure Begins.description: 草甸泽有史以来一直平静安宁，那里的生活节奏缓慢。近来，草甸泽陷入了困境。季节性降雨迟迟未至，田地变得贫瘠。更糟糕的是，派去提供救济的贸易马车失踪了，这助长了强盗在道路上出没的谣言。火焰生物比以往任何时候都更靠近村落。一周前，北方出现了一股不祥的黑烟，遮蔽了阳光。几位勇敢的村民冒险前去调查，但他们至今未归。黑烟的来源仍然未知。
Adventure Part 1: The Adventure Begins.caption: 本次谦卑林冒险适用于等级为1的4人小队。本模组包含了探索、社交、战斗三类遭遇。在运行前必须使用（Bestiary & NPCs）拓展内容。

Ashsnake.name: 灰蛇
Ashsnake.description:
灰烬蛇是巨大的怪兽，外形如同由火山岩浆塑造而成的蛇。在覆盖其身躯的木炭灰色鳞片之下，它们的体内翻涌着炽热高温。尽管从空洞眼窝中散发出的灼目光芒让灰烬蛇看似拥有视力，但它们完全依靠震动来感知周围环境。

神秘起源。关于灰烬蛇的起源知之甚少。它们最近从焦灼林地的灰烬平原之下涌现，并表现出难以满足的饥渴。灰烬蛇利用林地的灰烬堆掩藏行踪，得以逼近毫无戒备的猎物并发起伏击。虽然智力不高，但灰烬蛇具备捕食者的狡黠与生存本能，诡异得令人想起林地燃烧前栖息于此的动物群。

无目蠕行体。灰烬蛇无法以传统方式感知视觉与听觉。然而，它们擅长侦测最细微的震动，最轻的脚步声都足以引起其注意。有些学者认为通过保持绝对静止或许能从灰烬蛇的“视野”中“消失”，但可想而知，寻找志愿者验证该理论始终困难重重。

Ash Cover.name: 灰烬掩护
Ash Cover.description: 灰烬蛇在灰烬中掘穴时，进行敏捷（隐匿）检定时具有优势，并且其护甲等级获得+4加值。

Eruption.name: 喷发
Eruption.description: 当灰烬蛇从掘地中现身时，任何在其5尺范围内且体型至少比灰烬蛇小一级的生物必须进行一次[[/save format=long]]豁免，否则将被击倒&Reference[Prone apply=false]{倒地}。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 灰烬蛇每轮可以发动一次啃咬攻击以及一次[[/item Constrict]]或[[/item Crush]]攻击。

Constrict.name: 绞杀
Constrict.description:
[[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]且目标被&Reference[Grappled apply=false]{受擒}（逃脱DC14）。

直到受擒状态结束，目标被&Reference[Restrained apply=false]{束缚}且灰烬蛇无法对另一目标使用绞杀或碾压。

灰烬蛇可在其回合内随时释放目标。

Grappled & Restrained.name: 受擒与束缚
Grappled & Restrained.description:
目标陷入&Reference[Grappled apply=false]{受擒}状态（逃脱DC14）。

在受擒状态结束前，目标保持&Reference[Restrained apply=false]{束缚}状态。

Crush.name: 碾压
Crush.description: 该灰蛇碾压其受擒的目标，造成[[/damage average]]伤害。

Ashen Breath.name: 灰烬吐息
Ashen Breath.description:
灰烬蛇呼出一团过热的灰烬云，形成一个15尺锥形区域。

区域内的每个生物必须进行一次[[/save format=long]]，豁免失败则受到[[/damage average]]伤害，豁免成功则只受一半伤害。

Aspect of Fire.name: 火焰化身
Aspect of Fire.description:
火之相是一种由火焰与熔岩构成的元素生物，其超巨型的躯体很容易被误认为是一座小山。此相不仅是热量与能量的生物，更是毁灭与狂怒的化身，它似乎能从被其烈焰吞噬的森林中汲取力量。

原初化身。作为一种传说中的生物，有人认为这就是许多世纪前引发“大灾变”、造就焦木林的那位“火焰与毁灭之存在”。此相拥有令人恐惧的力量，足以对森林及其所有居民造成严重伤害。人们早已遗忘，这生物是在一场失传仪式中被召唤出来的。随后不久，它就被封印在焦木林之下，其存在持续影响着该地区。数百年的休眠削弱了此相，因为它的精华已渗入周边土地。自被释放以来，它开始通过用火焰吞噬植物、树木及其他生物来为自己积聚力量。一旦它获得足够能量来彻底挣脱将其束缚在焦木林的神秘枷锁，它将成为一股不可阻挡的力量，很可能给谦逊林全境带来烈焰毁灭。

沉睡中的躁动。近期发生的异常事件令许多著名学者困惑不已：异常具有攻击性的烬蝠、灰烬蛇的出现、森林火灾频率的增加，以及许多其他在谦逊林前所未见的现象。这一切的根源正是此相，它远非仅仅是传说。作为原初火焰的生物，它与自身的元素位面有着不可分割的联系。即便世代沉睡于林地下，此相也一直在躁动，它的存在导致隔绝物质位面与火元素位面的屏障减弱，使得较弱的生物得以穿越。

此相的精华也已渗入焦木林，导致该地景观呈现出远比以往更强烈的元素特性。林地本质的根本性转变，有效地阻碍了看护者们长久以来治愈这片焦土的努力。随着此相持续增长力量，更多这种有害的元素能量将被释放，甚至更强大的生物将从火焰中诞生。如果这种异界力量在森林中 unchecked 地蔓延，整个谦逊林都可能遭受与焦木林相同的命运。

Legendary Resistance (3/day).name: 传奇抗性 (3/日)
Legendary Resistance (3/day).description: 若火焰面相在豁免中失败，可以将其改为豁免成功。

Molten Skin.name: 熔岩皮肤
Molten Skin.description: 任何触及化身、在化身5尺范围内发动近战攻击、或在化身5尺范围内结束其回合的生物，将受到[[/damage 2d10 fire average]]伤害。化身5尺范围内的可燃物会瞬间燃起火焰。

Natural Light.name: 自然光
Natural Light.description: 该化身散发出60尺半径的{明亮光照}和额外60尺的{微光光照}。

Cooling.name: 冷却
Cooling.description: 如果火焰形态在一轮内受到50点或更多冷冻伤害，其速度将降至0，直到其下一回合结束。

Fuel for the Fire.name: 烈火燃料
Fuel for the Fire.description:
火焰化身不将植物生命视为困难地形。

每当该化身在其提供掩护的植物生命空间开始其回合时，它会将当前占据的所有空间内的植物生命烧尽，每消耗一个5尺方格的此类植物生命，它就会恢复[[/healing 1d4]]{1d4生命值}。若它以此方式恢复17或更多伤害，它会爆发，重新充能其熔岩投掷动作。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该化身发动两次[[/item Molten Fist]]攻击。

Stomp.name: 践踏
Stomp.description: [[/attack extended]]。 [[/damage extended average]]。目标必须进行一次[[/save format=long]]，否则将被击倒&Reference[prone apply=false]{倒地}。

Magma Throw.name: 岩浆投掷
Magma Throw.description:
该化身投掷出一团熔岩球。

选择化身60尺内的一个位置。目标位置15尺内的全部生物必须进行一次[[/save format=long]]。

若豁免失败，该生物受到[[/damage average]]伤害。若豁免成功，该生物仅受到一半伤害。

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: 火焰面相拥有3点传奇动作，可从下列选项中选择。每回合只可使用一个传奇动作选项，且只能在另一生物的回合结束时使用。该面相在其回合开始时恢复所有已消耗的传奇动作。

4fpkFuy54qfJCYVj.name: Molten Fist
4fpkFuy54qfJCYVj.description: The aspect makes a [[/item Molten Fist]] attack.

Magma Barrage.name: Magma Barrage
Magma Barrage.description: The aspect of fire uses its [[/item Magma Throw]] action. It may use this ability if it has not yet been recharged by dealing [[/damage]] of cold damage to itself.

Birdfolk Skeleton.name: Birdfolk Skeleton
Birdfolk Skeleton.description:
Deceased birdfolk granted a semblance of life through necromantic spells don’t have memory per se, but their skeletal bodies retain familiarity with tasks they performed in life. They also remain skilled with weapons they wielded in life, making them useful guards or servants.

Unnatural Life. Animated skeletons are common among the practitioners of the necromantic arts. Even at the Avium, where necromancy is forbidden in practice, it is taught in theory. A common exception is the use of animated skeletons for menial tasks around the college. The reanimation of birdfolk who did not give their express consent in life is seen as a violation of their memory, so these skeletons usually consist of former college staff who desired to stay and help long past their own time. Not all scholars agree that even this relatively benign form of necromancy should be allowed, while others don’t see why permission from the dead should be necessary, believing that “dead is dead”. Though the consent policy remains in place, heady debates over the ethics of certain forms of necromancy have resulted in the shunning of more morally flexible scholars.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: The birdfolk skeleton has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb any surface its talons could reasonably grip.

Caustic Slime.name: Caustic Slime
Caustic Slime.description:
Deep in the murky marshes of the Mokk Fields, where water lays stagnant and the stench of decay permeates all, the worlds of life and death intertwine. Within this ominous mire lurk some of the most unusual natural predators in Humblewood. Collectively known as “slimes”, these oozes move slowly through the muck, well-camouflaged by the dark and pungent waters, waiting to devour any hapless being that wanders within reach. Slimes are easily provoked, and while it isn’t difficult to outrun one, some who have strayed into a slime’s territory only find out too late that they have been detected. Fortunately for many swampland travelers, slimes have a slow metabolism, and can go without feeding for long periods. 

In addition to being an important part of the ecosystem, many slimes are either naturally magical, or yield organic materials which are in high demand among mages, scholars, and researchers. While slime hunting is a dangerous undertaking, the perch of Winnowing Reach was built on the labor of so-called “slime-wranglers”, whose skill collecting valuable residue from live slimes is directly responsible for transforming the once minor outpost into a thriving site for scholarly innovation.

Caustic Slime

These pale green oozes have an astringent chemical odor, which mixes with the smell of liquefied flesh from their latest meal. Owing to the slow speed at which they digest their victims, the bones of partially-digested meals can be seen through their transparent exterior. Dissolving remnants move within the slimes in a macabre semblance of motion.  This phenomena has earned them the nickname “green puppeteers”.

Natural Defenses. Capable of producing a lethal acid that can eat away at stone and metal, caustic slimes are especially deadly. Even the slightest touch on exposed fur or feathers can be dangerous. Many would-be heroes have met a slow, grim demise after being engulfed by these strange creatures.

Scientific Interest. Though hazardous, the acid produced by these slimes is also valued for its potential uses as a powerful sorcery reagent and an ingredient in potent potions. Some claim it can be distilled into practical applications, like a solvent for metallurgists and builders.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The slime can climb difficult surfaces, including vertically and upside down, without making an ability check.

Caustic.name: Caustic
Caustic.description: Any creature that touches the slime or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage average]] damage.

Split.name: Split
Split.description:
When a slime that is Medium or larger and has 10 or more hit points is hit with slashing damage, it splits into two new slimes.

Each new slime has hit points equal to half the original slime’s, rounded down.

New slimes are one size smaller than the previous size.

Split.name: Split
Split.condition: is Medium or larger and has 10 or more hit points is hit with slashing damage,

Cloud of Emberbats.name: Cloud of Emberbats
Cloud of Emberbats.description:
Curious and gentle creatures, these tiny bats have ashen fur and noses which sport a small candle-sized flame.

Winged Fire. Emberbats only started appearing in Humblewood after the calamity that befell the Scorched Grove, and scholars nearly all agree that the emergence of the creatures had something to do with the elemental magics present in the Grove. The flames that give the bats their name are lit through an internal combustion process that issues fuel from their nostrils as they exhale. Emberbats appear able to start and stop this process at will. The bats obviously do not need the flames to see, but it is hypothesized that the small candle serves to attract moths or other insects into their waiting mouths, greatly facilitating hunting.

Colonies of Combustion. Emberbats are most often seen flying in clouds consisting of many different families acting in unison. The bats perform virtually every task as a cohesive unit, from flying to hunting to nesting. The real threat they pose lies in the remarkable coordination of their colonies.

Alone, an emberbat is no more dangerous than a candle. But together they have the potential to burn like a pit of hot embers, and can easily set dry tinder ablaze. When a colony of emberbats attacks a target, it is usually for defensive purposes. The air temperature within the cloud rises dangerously fast, and it has to potential to cook the victim alive. When encountering a colony in the wild, it is best not to engage them. However, recently colonies of emberbats are acting aggressively towards travelers, harassing any who approach their expanding territories. Some swear they have seen emberbat supercolonies whose heat could be felt from yards away. 

Fine Familiars. Throughout Humblewood’s history, the docile nature of the emberbats have made them ideal familiars or animal companions, especially to masters who journey into dark places.

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: The swarm can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

Keen Hearing.name: Keen Hearing
Keen Hearing.description: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Flame Essence.name: Flame Essence
Flame Essence.description: Any creature that starts their turn within 5 feet of the emberbat swarm must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Bites.name: Bites
Bites.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: [[/damage 2d4 piercing average]] damage, or [[/damage 1d4 piercing average]] damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Note: Damage at half hit points or lower is configured in Versatile Damage.

Intense Heat.name: Intense Heat
Intense Heat.description: The heat generated by the emberbats is so intense that any creature within 30 feet must make a [[/save format=long]] when they enter this area, or start their turn inside of it, taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure.

Hot Interior.name: Hot Interior
Hot Interior.description: The emberbats’ space can be entered and moved through freely, but the heat inside is so intense that creatures inside this area take [[/damage average]] damage if they end their turn inside it.

Cobblefright.name: Cobblefright
Cobblefright.description:
Cobblefrights are undead monstrosities created through dark necromancy. Rumored to have been originally devised by the mad necromancer Lathrus of the Night’s Call, cobblefrights are made by linking several birdfolk skeletons together to form one frightening creature with enhanced physical properties. Among those who have studied Lathrus’ research, only the most reckless have tried to create a cobblefright of their own, often to disastrous effect.

Horror of Horrors. Cobblefrights are generally pieced together from the skeletons of five or six birdfolk. The combination of multiple bodies allows not only for a larger and more robust design, but also vastly increases the quantity of necromantic energies cobblefrights contain. This increased capacity for power provides cobblefrights with tremendous strength, as much as a dozen birdfolk combined. It also grants cobblefright bones greater durability. Their remarkable power and resilience is somewhat of a double-edged sword, as cobblefrights also require a large amount of necromantic energy to be sustained. The surviving records of cobblefright creators note that, quite unexpectedly, the creatures developed the ability to drain the life force of other living beings, replenishing their own energy in the process. This makes cobblefrights useful as independent sentries, so long as they have a steady supply of living beings to fuel them. 

Chaotic Psyche. The discordant parts that comprise cobblefrights exert tremendous strain on the bodies of these creatures. The source of this strain is rooted in the same magic that allows birdfolk skeletons to recall skills they once knew in life: the bones remember. Remnants of the soul such as memories, desires, fears, skills, and certain forms of knowledge are imprinted on the bones of the departed. When activated by necromantic energy, these conflicting impressions swirl chaotically within cobblefrights. Since cobblefrights are composed of multiple bodies, often originating from differing times, places, and walks of life, the impressions contained within the creatures are particularly volatile and chaotic. This constant internal conflict requires large and regular supplies of energy to keep cobblefrights stable, but it also grants them a surprising degree of resistance against those who would seek to wrest control of the creatures away from their creator. However, necromancers must be careful to maintain control over these dangerous creatures. Damaged cobblefrights will readily harvest their maker as an immediate source of life energy.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Whenever the cobblefright starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a [[/r 1d6]]. On a 6, the cobblefright goes berserk.

On each of its turns while berserk, the cobblefright attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the cobblefright attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself.

Once the cobblefright goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The cobblefright makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks. One of those attacks can be replaced by a [[/item Grab]] attack.

Grab.name: Grab
Grab.description:
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack +7]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature not grappled by the cobblefright. Hit: The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 15).

The cobblefright can grapple up to 2 targets at once. Once at the start of its turn for each target it has grappled, the cobblefright can squeeze its victim. The target must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save.

Soul Siphon.name: Soul Siphon
Soul Siphon.description:
One creature the cobblefright has grappled must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failed save, or half that amount on a success.

The target’s hit point maximum is reduced by the amount of necrotic damage taken, and the cobblefright regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.

Emberbat.name: Emberbat
Emberbat.description:
Curious and gentle creatures, these tiny bats have ashen fur and noses which sport a small candle-sized flame.

Winged Fire. Emberbats only started appearing in Humblewood after the calamity that befell the Scorched Grove, and scholars nearly all agree that the emergence of the creatures had something to do with the elemental magics present in the Grove. The bats obviously do not need the flames to see, but it is hypothesized that the small candle serves to attract moths or other insects into their waiting mouths, greatly facilitating hunting.

The bats perform virtually every task as a cohesive unit, from flying to hunting to nesting. The real threat they pose lies in the remarkable coordination of their colonies.

Alone, an emberbat is no more dangerous than a candle. But together they have the potential to burn like a pit of hot embers, and can easily set dry tinder ablaze. When a colony of emberbats attacks a target, it is usually for defensive purposes. The air temperature within the cloud rises dangerously fast, and it has to potential to cook the victim alive. When encountering a colony in the wild, it is best not to engage them. However, recently colonies of emberbats are acting aggressively towards travelers, harassing any who approach their expanding territories. Some swear they have seen emberbat supercolonies whose heat could be felt from yards away. 

Fine Familiars. Throughout Humblewood’s history, the docile nature of the emberbats have made them ideal familiars or animal companions, especially to masters who journey into dark places.

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: The emberbat can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

Keen Hearing.name: Keen Hearing
Keen Hearing.description: The emberbat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Ember Flame.name: Ember Flame
Ember Flame.description: The emberbat can create a flame from its nose at will. It sheds bright light in a 5-foot-radius and dim light in another 5 feet beyond this. This effect lasts until it is dismissed, which the emberbat can do at anytime. When lit, the flame also provides a small damage boost to the emberbat’s bite (already included in stat block).

Fire Form.name: Fire Form
Fire Form.description:
The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes [[/damage average]].

In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Illumination.name: Illumination
Illumination.description: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 ft..

Water Susceptibility.name: Water Susceptibility
Water Susceptibility.description:
For every 5 ft. the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes [[/damage]] damage.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured for the damage the creature takes based on the distance traveled. A scale of 1 is 5 feet, and a scale of 10 is 50 feet.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The elemental makes two [[/item Touch]] attacks.

Touch.name: Touch
Touch.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]].

If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes [[/damage average activity=CPY39RrJXPmFdxjS]] at the start of each of its turns.

Forest Prowler.name: Forest Prowler
Forest Prowler.description:
Forest prowlers feature prominently throughout folktales in Humblewood, notably as monsters in frightful stories. These cat-like beasts have the unique ability to grow leaves and moss on their spotted fur, allowing them to camouflage perfectly within the forest canopy. 

Fable and Folklore. One of the reasons forest prowlers have attained such mythic status is due to their elusive nature. They are adept at moving unseen through the canopy where they hunt, and their skills as ambush predators means that few who see them live to tell the tale. In some communities the killing of a forest prowler is considered a rite of passage among beast hunters. The large fangs seen adorning the necks of Humblewood’s greatest hunters and warriors, and cloaks made from prowler fur, are trophies that showcase one’s prowess and skill.

Fierce Hunter. Forest prowlers are apex predators. They can claim virtually any prey they desire, but usually target deer, elk, and other large herbivores. Prowlers use their powerful bodies and gripping claws to drag their kill up into their tree nests, where it can be consumed at their leisure. These felines are known to travel long and winding paths through the forest, residing in temporary shelters throughout the seasons. Although nomadic, the prowlers are quite territorial of whatever area they currently inhabit. Relatively passive in the winter, they are most active in the spring and summer during peak hunting and breeding seasons.

Natural Camouflage.name: Natural Camouflage
Natural Camouflage.description: The prowler has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made in the forest. Creatures who attack a target that cannot see them have advantage on their attack roll.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description:
If the prowler moves at least 10 feet toward a creature and then hits it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]{prone}.

The prowler can use its bonus action to make another claw attack against this target.

Ambuscade.name: Ambuscade
Ambuscade.description: The prowler can use the &Reference[dash]{dash} or &Reference[hide]{hide} action as a bonus action.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The prowler makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and one [[/item Bite]] attack.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. If the target of the bite attack is prone, it takes an additional [[/damage average activity=m9sMaJKoXDA4EK4t]] damage.

Charge.name: Charge
Charge.description:
If the skeleton moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage average]] damage.

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked &Reference[prone apply=false]{prone}.

Lesser Demon.name: Lesser Demon
Lesser Demon.description:
For those still new to the art of summoning, a fumbled attempt to conjure forth an entity of great power often results in the appearance of a lesser demon in its place. These beings are lowly, vexing creatures, eager to sow discord wherever they have been called. 

Vile and Malicious. While there are all manner of devils and demons that seek to terrorize the good folk of the world, others are more off-putting and disgusting—an embarrassing blunder for the fledgling witch or wizard whose invocation went awry. Although not particularly powerful, lesser demons can still pose a serious threat to inexperienced conjurors and unsuspecting civilians.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The demon makes two attacks, one with its [[/item Bite]] and one with its [[/item Claws]].

Foul Odor.name: Foul Odor
Foul Odor.description:
The demon emits a cloud of poisonous gas that fills a 20-foot sphere and persists for 1 minute until it disperses into the surrounding air. The cloud spreads around corners, and the affected area is heavily obscured.

Any creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a [[/save format=long]] against the poison.

On a failed save, the creature spends its action on that turn retching and reeling. Creatures immune to poison are immune to this effect.

A moderate wind (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses the cloud after 4 rounds. A strong wind (at least 20 miles per hour) will disperse it after 1 round.

Mountain Lion.name: Mountain Lion
Mountain Lion.description:
The mountain lions of Humblewood’s Crest Mountains are more than the mere beasts travelers may mistake them for. Covered in rocky protrusions that serve to protect as well as camouflage them, mountain lions possess special powers as a result of their ties to the elemental earth of their territory.

Mountain Stalker. Mountain lions live and hunt in their craggy mountain homes. They are natural climbers and prefer to ambush unsuspecting prey rather than engage in prolonged chases across the treacherous cliffs. A pride of mountain lions is led and protected by a large female. Males compete for the right to mate, and work together as a hunting party. While not as adept at pack hunting as wolves, a few mountain lions working in tandem can take down dangerous creatures of unusual size, including basilisks and griffons.

Roar of the Earth. Owing to the magic of the elemental earth, mountain lions can gain limited control over nearby rocks with their roar. Using this ability, they can cause rockslides to hinder their prey’s escape or inflict critical damage. The ability takes a great deal of energy, so many mountain lions use it sparingly, knowing it will be some time before they can call upon it again.

Keen Smell.name: Keen Smell
Keen Smell.description: The mountain lion has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

Pounce.name: Pounce
Pounce.description:
If the mountain lion moves at least 20 feet towards a creature and then hits it with its claw attack on the same turn, the target must succeed a [[/save format=long]] or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false]{prone}.

The mountain lion can make a [[/item Bite]] attack against a prone target as a bonus action.

Call Avalanche.name: Call Avalanche
Call Avalanche.description:
With a mystic roar, the mountain lion can call down the very rocks.

So long as it is in mountainous terrain, it can use its action to cause a rockslide to fall within a 15-foot-radius of a space it can see within 60 feet.

Creatures in this area must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure and half as much on a success.

Orb.name: Orb
Orb.description: It is magic, and registers as conjuration magic if examined with detect magic or a similar effect

Shifting Slime.name: Shifting Slime
Shifting Slime.description:
Deep in the murky marshes of the Mokk Fields, where water lays stagnant and the stench of decay permeates all, the worlds of life and death intertwine. Within this ominous mire lurk some of the most unusual natural predators in Humblewood. Collectively known as “slimes”, these oozes move slowly through the muck, well-camouflaged by the dark and pungent waters, waiting to devour any hapless being that wanders within reach. Slimes are easily provoked, and while it isn’t difficult to outrun one, some who have strayed into a slime’s territory only find out too late that they have been detected. Fortunately for many swampland travelers, slimes have a slow metabolism, and can go without feeding for long periods. 

In addition to being an important part of the ecosystem, many slimes are either naturally magical, or yield organic materials which are in high demand among mages, scholars, and researchers. While slime hunting is a dangerous undertaking, the perch of Winnowing Reach was built on the labor of so-called “slime-wranglers”, whose skill collecting valuable residue from live slimes is directly responsible for transforming the once minor outpost into a thriving site for  scholarly innovation.

Shifting Slime

A type of large and fluid ooze, shifting slimes have an iridescent hue to them which seems to shift as they move. According to slime-wranglers, they can use magical energy to create an eerie bioluminescence. Shifting slime residue is a highly sought after potent reagent, but it is hard to come by. Despite their size, these slimes are elusive and generally spend their time below ground where visibility is low. They can be quite difficult to locate when they conceal themselves in the subterranean darkness, though these strange creatures are known to leave trails of bioluminescent residue to lure in prey. 

Adaptive Defenses. This type of slime can harness magical energy within its form. Shifting slimes absorb and store magic passively over time, but are also capable of absorbing magical jolts from spells. It is unclear exactly how much energy they can store, or for how long.

Shifting slimes can develop a temporary immunity to various types of magic after exposure. This immunity in turn makes it exceptionally difficult to destroy the slimes with a single type of magical energy. Luckily for slime-wranglers, shifting slimes are only capable of containing one energy type at a time. 

Manifestation of Stored Power. After absorbing magical energy, these slimes will change color based on the type of power absorbed. Because of the rarity of shifting slimes, only a handful of people have witnessed these changes. But, over generations, skilled slime-wranglers have managed to record which color a shifting slime will turn in response to different types of magic.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Spider Climb.name: Spider Climb
Spider Climb.description: The slime can climb difficult surfaces, including vertically and upside down, without making an ability check.

Pseudopod.name: Pseudopod
Pseudopod.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. The target is &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is &Reference[restrained apply=false]{restrained} and the shifting slime can’t make a pseudopod attack against another target.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The shifting slime makes one [[/item Pseudopod]] attack against a target it is grappling that is at least one size smaller than itself. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends.

The swallowed target is &Reference[Restrained], it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the shifting slime, and it must make a [[/save constitution 13 format=long]] at the start of each of its turns taking [[/damage 1d6 acid average]] damage on a failure.

If the shifting slime used its adaptive ability to become immune to a damage type, the damage dealt to the target on a failed save becomes that type instead. The shifting slime can have only one target swallowed at a time.

If the shifting slime dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it, and may move freely as the body of the slime quivers and neutralizes into an inert puddle of goo.

Split.name: Split
Split.description:
When a slime that is Medium or larger and has 10 or more hit points is hit with slashing damage, it splits into two new slimes.

Each new slime has hit points equal to half the original slime’s, rounded down. New slimes are one size smaller than the previous size.

New shifting slimes each have the same damage type immunity as their parent slime and retain the Adaptive ability.

Adaptive.name: Adaptive
Adaptive.description:
Each time the slime is hit by a spell that deals damage, it can become immune to that damage type for 1 hour.

When the slime changes the damage type it’s immune to, its color changes based on the table on the below. The slime can only be immune to one damage type at a time.

Normally, shifting slimes are iridescent, shimmering with all the colors of the rainbow.

Damage Type Slime Color
Acid Lime Green
Cold Ice Blue
Fire Bright Crimson
Force Clear
Lightning Vibrant Yellow
Necrotic Dark Black
Poison Dark Green
Psychic Bright Violet
Radient Warm Orange
Thunder Bright White

Sticky Slime.name: Sticky Slime
Sticky Slime.description:
Deep in the murky marshes of the Mokk Fields, where water lays stagnant and the stench of decay permeates all, the worlds of life and death intertwine. Within this ominous mire lurk some of the most unusual natural predators in Humblewood. Collectively known as “slimes”, these oozes move slowly through the muck, well-camouflaged by the dark and pungent waters, waiting to devour any hapless being that wanders within reach. Slimes are easily provoked, and while it isn’t difficult to outrun one, some who have strayed into a slime’s territory only find out too late that they have been detected. Fortunately for many swampland travelers, slimes have a slow metabolism, and can go without feeding for long periods. 

In addition to being an important part of the ecosystem, many slimes are either naturally magical, or yield organic materials which are in high demand among mages, scholars, and researchers. While slime hunting is a dangerous undertaking, the perch of Winnowing Reach was built on the labor of so-called “slime-wranglers”, whose skill collecting valuable residue from live slimes is directly responsible for transforming the once minor outpost into a thriving site for  scholarly innovation.

Sticky Slime

A semi-solid type of ooze, sticky slimes are far more robust than their cousins. Experienced slime wranglers know never to attack them directly with weapons. The rubbery bodies of sticky slimes can suck a blade out of a wielder’s hands, leaving the attacker unarmed. 

True to Form. Sticky slimes are wholly described by their name. They leave a trail of extremely thick adhesive residue in their wake. While the residue itself is harmless, it can trap adventurers where they stand, and sticky slimes tend to live in proximity of far more threatening monsters.

Amorphous.name: Amorphous
Amorphous.description: The slime can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

Pseudopod.name: Pseudopod
Pseudopod.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d4 + 1 bludgeoning average]] damage.

Slime Trail.name: Slime Trail
Slime Trail.description:
The slime leaves a trail of ooze behind it that remains tacky for up to 15 minutes.

A creature that steps in the ooze must succeed a [[/save format=long]] or become &Reference[Restrained apply=false]{restrained}.

A creature may attempt the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Mucus.name: Mucus
Mucus.description:
When the slime is hit by a melee attack, the attacker must succeed on a [[/save strength 12 format=long]] or their weapon becomes stuck in the slime.

The weapon can be wrenched out by using an action to make a [[/check athletics format=long]], freeing the weapon on a success.

All weapons stuck in the slime can be retrieved once the slime is slain.

Swarm of Emberbats.name: Swarm of Emberbats
Swarm of Emberbats.description:
Curious and gentle creatures, these tiny bats have ashen fur and noses which sport a small candle-sized flame.

Winged Fire. Emberbats only started appearing in Humblewood after the calamity that befell the Scorched Grove, and scholars nearly all agree that the emergence of the creatures had something to do with the elemental magics present in the Grove. The flames that give the bats their name are lit through an internal combustion process that issues fuel from their nostrils as they exhale. Emberbats appear able to start and stop this process at will. The bats obviously do not need the flames to see, but it is hypothesized that the small candle serves to attract moths or other insects into their waiting mouths, greatly facilitating hunting.

Colonies of Combustion. Emberbats are most often seen flying in clouds consisting of many different families acting in unison. The bats perform virtually every task as a cohesive unit, from flying to hunting to nesting. The real threat they pose lies in the remarkable coordination of their colonies.

Alone, an emberbat is no more dangerous than a candle. But together they have the potential to burn like a pit of hot embers, and can easily set dry tinder ablaze. When a colony of emberbats attacks a target, it is usually for defensive purposes. The air temperature within the cloud rises dangerously fast, and it has to potential to cook the victim alive. When encountering a colony in the wild, it is best not to engage them. However, recently colonies of emberbats are acting aggressively towards travelers, harassing any who approach their expanding territories. Some swear they have seen emberbat supercolonies whose heat could be felt from yards away. 

Fine Familiars. Throughout Humblewood’s history, the docile nature of the emberbats have made them ideal familiars or animal companions, especially to masters who journey into dark places.

Echolocation.name: Echolocation
Echolocation.description: The swarm can’t use its blindsight while deafened.

Keen Hearing.name: Keen Hearing
Keen Hearing.description: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

Flame Essence.name: Flame Essence
Flame Essence.description: Any creature that starts their turn within 5 feet of the emberbat swarm must make a [[/save format=long]], taking [[/damage average]] damage on a failure.

Swarm.name: Swarm
Swarm.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny bat. The swarm can’t regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

Bites.name: Bites
Bites.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, or [[/damage average activity=xOQWaq5i2e12cfD8]] damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Wakewyrm.name: Wakewyrm
Wakewyrm.description:
Wakewyrms are massive reptiles that have aspects of both snakes and eels. On rare occasions they’ve been spotted close to the shores of the Talongrip Coast, though many are quick to dismiss these accounts. Their name originates from the powerful tidal waves their bodies cause, which pose a considerable threat to nearby vessels. 

Ocean Tales. Despite their size, wakewyrms are elusive, able to hide within the vast expanse of the ocean. The rarity of this creature has bred many rumors about the exact nature of wakewyrms. All sailors know at least a few stories about bizarre creatures of the sea, including fantastical accounts of wakewyrms that lurk in the ocean’s gloomy depths, able to sink an entire fleet of ships. Such tales are more often fabrications than not, as few have actually encountered these creatures.

Devourer from the Deeps. Wakewyrms are more than a 100 feet long and weigh over 1000 tons. Their lashing tails, snapping jaws, and huge bodies can deal significant damage to a ship’s hull, though they prefer to swallow sailors whole, swiftly pulling them into the fathoms below with hardly more than a splash. Filling their gullet with as many creatures as possible, wakewyrms let their strong stomachs take care of their meals. While a fine tactic for devouring fish or other large marine creatures, wakewyrms that swallow adventurers whole sometimes find the snack too much to handle. 

Though wakewyrms rarely encounter sailing vessels as they cross the ocean looking for food, the results are often violent. Afterwards, all that remains is nothing but a derelict phantom ship, found wrecked against the rocks of distant shores.

Hold Breath.name: Hold Breath
Hold Breath.description: The wakewyrm can hold its breath for 1 hour.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The wakewyrm makes two attacks, one with its [[/item Bite]] and one with its [[/item Tail]], or two bite attacks.

Bite.name: Bite
Bite.description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]]. The target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[grappled apply=false]{grappled} (escape DC 16).

The wakewyrm can only grapple one creature at a time, and cannot make bite attacks against other creatures while it has a creature grappled.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.description:
The wakewyrm makes a [[/item Bite]] attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling, and if the attack hits the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. 

The swallowed target is &Reference[Blinded apply=false]{blinded} and &Reference[Restrained apply=false]{restrained}, it has &Reference[total cover] against attacks and other effects outside the wakewyrm, and it takes [[/damage average]] damage at the start of each of the wakewyrm’s turns. 

If the wakewyrm takes 18 or more points of damage from a creature inside of it, the wakewyrm must succeed on a [[/save constitution 15 format=long]] at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall &Reference[Prone] in a space within 10 feet of the wakewyrm. 

If the wakewyrm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it, and it can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement.

After death, internal gasses keep the wakewyrm’s body afloat for several hours, before it begins to sink gradually to a watery grave.

save.condition: It must be grappling a creature

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the [[lookup @name lowercase]] remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] deals double damage to objects and structures.

Ardwyn, Elder of Meadowfen.name: Ardwyn, Elder of Meadowfen
Ardwyn, Elder of Meadowfen.description:
A venerable huden gallus with rounded grouse-like proportions and feathers that have long since lost the sheen of youth. As the village Elder, Ardwyn is a figure of authority within Meadowfen. She and her late husband kept the village running until his death, after which she took on the role alone. Elder Ardwyn is a kind and perceptive woman who exudes leadership. The villagers look to her for guidance.

Ardwyn uses the priest stat block, adjusted with the racial traits of a huden gallus.

She is neutral good.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
Spellcasting.description:
Ardwyn is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrip (at will): [[/item .oJcZz9OQAaVgZzZR]]{light}, [[/item .vwUFST3Xpxt3OI2K]]{sacred flame}, [[/item .Hrf2zg3Qehten7fF]]{thaumaturgy}

1st level (4 slots): [[/item .Tmd0Thf5wN9LDt0E]]{cure wounds}, [[/item .RiBTts7Vm4HZTHxq]]{guiding bolt}, [[/item .bF4OqVwUrPowxCOs]]{sanctuary}

2nd level (3 slots): [[/item .K5G7y6sCu9Mt23Gz]]{lesser restoration}, [[/item .jBnu6cQXA7IVrJp2]]{spiritual weapon}

3rd level (2 slots): [[/item .E2EKVIKr9Nib4Ir8]]{dispel magic}, [[/item .YEyL3IoQr0owey4h]]{spirit guardians}

Divine Eminence.name: Divine Eminence
Divine Eminence.description:
As a bonus action, Ardwyn can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal extra [[/damage average]] damage to a target on a hit.

This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If Ardwyn expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by 1d6 for each level above 1st.

Foundry Note

Scaling is configured to adjust damage based on the level of the spell slot used. A scale of 1 represents the base damage, while a scale of 9 indicates that a 9th-level spell slot has been expended.

Communal.name: Communal
Communal.description: Whenever Ardwyn makes an Intelligence (History) check related to the history of her race, culture, or community, she is considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of her normal proficiency bonus.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description:
Using their feathered arms, Ardwyn can slow their fall and glide short distances. When falling slow can use their reaction to spread their arms, stiffen their wing feathers, and slow their descent.

While doing so, you continue to fall gently at a speed of 60 feet per round, taking no fall damage when you land. If you would fall at least 10 feet in this way, you may fly up to your movement speed in one direction you choose, although you cannot choose to move upwards, landing in the space you finish your movement.

You cannot glide while carrying heavy weapons or wielding a shield (though you may drop any held items as part of your reaction to spread your arms).

You cannot glide while wearing heavy armor or if you are encumbered.

Wing Flap.name: Wing Flap
Wing Flap.description: As a bonus action, Ardwyn can use her powerful feathered arms to propel themself upward a distance equal to half their movement speed. Ardwyn can use it in conjunction with a regular jump, but not while gliding.

Light.name: Light
Light.description:
You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. Until the spell ends, the object sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. The spell ends if you cast it again or dismiss it as an action.

If you target an object held or worn by a hostile creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw to avoid the spell.

materials.value: A firefly or phosphorescent moss.

Sacred Flame.name: Sacred Flame
Sacred Flame.description:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

Thaumaturgy.name: Thaumaturgy
Thaumaturgy.description:
You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.
  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.
  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.
  • You create a sound that originates from a point of your choice within range.
  • You cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.
  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Cure Wounds.name: Cure Wounds
Cure Wounds.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

Guiding Bolt.name: Guiding Bolt
Guiding Bolt.description:
A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 4d6 radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage, thanks to the mystical dim light glittering on the target until then.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Sanctuary.name: Sanctuary
Sanctuary.description:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a Fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack or casts a spell that affects an enemy creature, this spell ends.

materials.value: A small silver mirror

Lesser Restoration.name: Lesser Restoration
Lesser Restoration.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

Spiritual Weapon.name: Spiritual Weapon
Spiritual Weapon.description:
You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration or until you cast this spell again. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against a creature within 5 feet of it.

The weapon can take whatever form you choose. Clerics of deities who are associated with a particular weapon (as St. Cuthbert is known for his mace and Thor for his hammer) make this spell's effect resemble that weapon.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above the 2nd.

Dispel Magic.name: 解除魔法
Dispel Magic.description:
在施法距离内指定一名生物、一个物件或一处魔法效应。所有影响该目标的三环或更低环阶法术即告终止。每个影响目标的四环或更高环阶法术都需要以你的施法属性进行一次属性检定（DC 10 + 目标法术环阶），检定成功时目标法术终止。

升环施法： 你直接终止影响目标的小于等于该施法环阶的法术效应。

Spirit Guardians.name: Spirit Guardians
Spirit Guardians.description:
You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey (your choice). If you are evil, they appear fiendish.

When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by it. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3d8 radiant damage (if you are good or neutral) or 3d8 necrotic damage (if you are evil). On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

materials.value: A holy symbol

Ash Tree.name: Ash Tree
Ash Tree.description: Oakheart is a huge tree-shaped creature with charred bark that smolders in places, and many small flames which burn on his branches, giving the impression of leaves. Once a treant, he bathed in the primal energies of the Scorched Grove, transforming into an entity so thoroughly possessed of the element of flame that he’s capable of serving as The Borealus’* keeper. He is the artifact’s guardian, and will not relinquish the staff until he has been convinced that whoever has disturbed him can control the staff’s considerable power, and that they mean to maintain the natural balance he sacrificed himself to protect.

False Appearance.name: False Appearance
False Appearance.description: While the Ash Tree remains motionless, they appear as a great oak with charred bark that smolders in places and flames in place of leaves.

Siege Monster.name: Siege Monster
Siege Monster.description: The Ash Tree deals double damage to objects and structures.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The Ash Tree makes two [[/item Slam]] attacks.

Animate Trees.name: Animate Trees
Animate Trees.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically animates one or two trees it can see within 60 feet of it. These trees have the same statistics as a treant, except they have Intelligence and Charisma scores of 1, they can't speak, and they have only the Slam action option.

An animated tree acts as an ally of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]. The tree remains animate for 1 day or until it dies; until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] dies or is more than 120 feet from the tree; or until the [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes a bonus action to turn it back into an inanimate tree. The tree then takes root if possible.

Benna Seridan.name: Benna Seridan
Benna Seridan.description:
Bandit clans are commanded by generals. Serving as both a battle-tested warrior and master strategist, they alone coordinate the disparate band of thieves and outlaws that make up the collective. While military monikers are used to refer to bandit leadership, more than combat prowess is needed to maintain order in these volatile organizations. A dominating personality and charismatic voice are as necessary as a swift blade and a sharp mind. Cervans don’t typically take to brigandry, but their practical skills and ability to survive in even the most adverse situations make those with loose morals and dubious ambitions a natural fit.

Benna Seridan

Benna is a tall, scarred grove cervan, who wears a red bandana over her lost left eye. The leader of the Bandit Coalition, she is an idealist who believes that Alderheart’s canopy, the symbol of birdfolk power in the region, should be burned and its resources looted to help those displaced by the flames.

Benna lived a tranquil village life until her mother, a respected village elder and seer, foretold that the flames would come. Word was sent to Alderheart’s Council, asking for supplies and aid, both of which were denied because the Council didn’t believe in the power of the seer’s visions.

When the flames had all but consumed the village, birdfolk support arrived, but it was too late. Benna lost her family. She also lost her left eye and left ear due to the burns she sustained while helping others escape from the blaze. She fell in with the bandits and quickly rose through their ranks, thanks to her passion and purpose. She is a seasoned veteran who has been building the bandit forces, and utilizing the organization to care for humblefolk left homeless by the spreading fires.

Benna Seridan uses the @Compendium[hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-cs-beastiary.fckMIMrlaPxcbjzD]{cervan bandit general} stat block, but the scimitar in her main hand is a blade of the wood *(+1 to attack and damage rolls, see @Compendium[hpp-humblewood-campaign-setting.humblewood-campaign-setting.o45baujDUWYHKxfm]{Appendix D: New Magic Items}), and a shortsword (1d6 + 3 piercing damage) in her off hand.

Surge of Vigor.name: Surge of Vigor
Surge of Vigor.description: If an attack deals over half of Benna’s current remaining hit points in damage (even if their hit points are reduced to 0 by the attack), they immediately regain [[/healing 1d12 + 2 average]].

Standing Leap.name: Standing Leap
Standing Leap.description: Benna’s long jump is 30 feet, and their base high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: Benna makes three melee attacks, two with their scimitar and one with their dagger. Alternatively, the general can make two ranged attack with their daggers.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Benna adds 2 to their AC against one melee attack that would hit them. The general must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Blade of the Wood.name: Blade of the Wood
Blade of the Wood.description:
Weapon (scimitar), rare (requires attunement)

A finely crafted sword with delicate etchings, it resonates with a faint hum of life.

You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The sword has 2 charges. You can expend a charge and speak the command word to cast @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.9gYGkrL6qFTsE6fw]{Spike Growth} (save DC 16) centered on yourself. You can pass through this terrain unaffected.

The sword regains one charge each day at dawn.

Spike Growth.name: 荆棘丛生
Spike Growth.description:
以施法距离内一点为中心周围 20 尺的地面扭曲变形，大片坚硬的棘刺破土而出。该区域在法术持续时间内视为困难地形。而生物进入该区域或在其中移动时，其每移动 5 尺就要受到 2d4 点穿刺伤害。

法术导致的地面变形经过刻意的掩饰，使其看起来并无异样。如果生物在你施展该法术时不能看见该区域，则它必须进行一次感知（察觉）检定，检定成功则能发现该区域隐藏的危险。

materials.value: 七根棘刺或七根嫩枝，每根都要削尖

Birdfolk Dockmaster.name: Birdfolk Dockmaster
Birdfolk Dockmaster.description: It may be odd to see birdfolk working the docks and ships of Saltar’s Port, but the sea is a way of life for some folk. Jobs in the seafaring industry are as lucrative as they are tough. For the birdfolk that choose to ply their trade on the water, life is about order and efficiency. One improperly stowed barrel or poorly lashed line can spell disaster on the sea. Dockmasters take their marine jobs very seriously.

Leather Armor.name: Leather Armor
Leather Armor.description: The breastplate and shoulder protectors of this armor are made of leather that has been stiffened by being boiled in oil. The rest of the armor is made of softer and more flexible materials.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the dockmaster can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Confidence.name: Confidence
Confidence.description: The dockmaster adds their Charisma modifier to their initiative rolls.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Once per turn, the dockmaster deals an extra [[/damage 1d6 average]] damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and they have advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 ft. of an ally of the dockmaster that isn’t incapacitated and the dockmaster doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] makes a number of attacks in one action. These attacks can be of the same type or a mixed variety of its attack actions.

Birdfolk Farmer.name: Birdfolk Farmer
Birdfolk Farmer.description: Simple farmers can be found across the Wood, providing necessary food and supplies to the cities. There are many places in Humblewood where digging up large heaps of soil would either be impractical or damaging to the forest. While traditional farms exists in Humblewood, the majority of farms are built in the canopies in or around cities. Farming in the canopy consists of growing flowering moss gardens or fruit-bearing vines on the branches of perch trees. Canopy farms can also include the raising of large insects for food, or silkworms for clothing.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the farmer can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Birdfolk Guard.name: Birdfolk Guard
Birdfolk Guard.description: Aspiring recruits from all over the Wood flock to the Perch Guard headquarters in the capital of Alderheart to join their ranks. After successful training, these newly sworn guards return to their home perch. They serve with pride, acting as the perch’s first line of defense. Under the Humblefolk Treaty, members of the Perch Guard are tasked to aid nearby villages on the forest floor whenever necessary. In larger cities like Alderheart, the Perch Guard are also responsible for dealing with inner city issues such as robbery, bar fights, and investi- gating and arresting criminals.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the guard can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects or heavy weapons, (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Spear.name: Spear
Spear.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]] or [[/damage twoHanded average]] if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

Birdfolk Militia.name: Birdfolk Militia
Birdfolk Militia.description:
In smaller perches, where a guard force may be minimal or nonexistent, town security consists of a locally-organized militia. Anyone can enlist in these groups, provided they are upstanding citizens. They can be called upon by the Perch Guard to perform duties ranging from policing streets to supplementing military efforts.

Cara Stormsinger. A tawny-feathered swift strig woman from Meadowfen, Cara is the captain of the village militia. She was responsible for assembling the team of villagers who went out to investigate the black plume of smoke that appeared over Meadowfen’s horizon. She endured a harrowing journey to return home and relay Ashbarrow’s fate to Elder Ardwynn. Cara uses the birdfolk militia stat block adjusted with the racial traits of a swift strig. She is lawful good.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the militia can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Birdfolk Sailor.name: Birdfolk Sailor
Birdfolk Sailor.description:
For birdfolk who take up the seafaring trade, their home is as much on the ocean as it is at port. They relish the salt spray and stiff winds, finding the closed spaces of forest life to be stifling compared to the wide-open expanse of the sea.

Peculiar Design

Birdfolk ship design often causes confusion among other seafaring races due to the relative absence of rigging. While cordage is needed to keep sails in place and cargo stored, nets and climbing ropes prove less necessary when the crew is capable of limited flight. A birdfolk sailor can simply lash a rope to their leg, open their wings, and let the ocean breeze carry them up to the sails or to a lookout post on the main mast.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the sailor can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Birdfolk Skirmisher.name: Birdfolk Skirmisher
Birdfolk Skirmisher.description: The bulk of the Perch Guard’s military force are a light infantry called ‘The Spears.” They train relentlessly with polearm weapons perfectly suited for branch-to-branch combat. Many are also skilled at ranged attacks with these weapons, as well as performing special diving maneuvers, making them an even greater threat to enemies below. In times of peace, skirmishers often serve as skilled hunters, following the direction of trackers to collect enough food for entire villages.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, the skirmisher can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Drop Attack.name: Drop Attack
Drop Attack.description: The skirmisher can make an attack during their glide. If they do so they deal an extra [[/damage 1d8 average]] points of damage.

Chain Shirt.name: Chain Shirt
Chain Shirt.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, a chain shirt is worn between layers of clothing or leather. This armor offers modest protection to the wearer's upper body and allows the sound of the rings rubbing against one another to be muffled by outer layers.

Spear.name: Spear
Spear.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage extended average]] or [[/damage twoHanded average]] if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Bita, the Council Speaker.name: Bita, the Council Speaker
Bita, the Council Speaker.description: Bita is a bright gallus whose elegant white plumage resembles that of a peacock. As the Birdfolk Council’s Speaker, she is always first to address those who have been granted an audience with the Council. She takes her duties as the Speaker and as a Council member very seriously. Despite her profound affection for Humblewood and its citizens, she often comes off as severe and cold. Bita believes in doing what’s best for the folks of the Wood, and sometimes this means making level-headed, tough decisions. Bita uses the noble stat block, adjusted with the racial traits of a bright gallus. She is lawful good.

Breastplate.name: Breastplate
Breastplate.description: This armor consists of a fitted metal chest piece worn with supple leather. Although it leaves the legs and arms relatively unprotected, this armor provides good protection for the wearer's vital organs while leaving the wearer relatively unencumbered.

Rapier.name: Rapier
Rapier.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + 1 piercing average]] damage.

Parry.name: Parry
Parry.description: Bita adds 2 to its AC against one melee Attack that would hit it. To do so, the noble must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: Using your feathered arms, you can slow your fall, and glide short distances. When falling you can use your reaction to spread your arms, stiffen your wing feathers, and slow your descent. While doing so, you continue to fall gently at a speed of 60 feet per round, taking no fall damage when you land. If you would fall at least 10 feet in this way, you may fly up to your movement speed in one direction you choose, although you cannot choose to move upwards, landing in the space you finish your movement. You cannot glide while carrying heavy weapons or wielding a shield (though you may drop any held items as part of your reaction to spread your arms). You cannot glide while wearing heavy armor, or if you are encumbered.

Wing Flap.name: Wing Flap
Wing Flap.description: As a bonus action, you can use your powerful feathered arms to propel yourself upward a distance equal to half your movement speed. You can use it in conjunction with a regular jump, but not while gliding.

Communal.name: Communal
Communal.description: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the history of your race, culture, or community, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

Inspiring.name: Inspiring
Inspiring.description: By spending an action and giving words of advice or encouragement, you can inspire an ally who is able to see and hear you. The ally can roll a [[/r 1d4]] and add the number rolled to their next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw.

Cara Stormsinger.name: Cara Stormsinger
Cara Stormsinger.description:
In smaller perches, where a guard force may be minimal or nonexistent, town security consists of a locally-organized militia. Anyone can enlist in these groups, provided they are upstanding citizens. They can be called upon by the Perch Guard to perform duties ranging from policing streets to supplementing military efforts.

Cara Stormsinger. A tawny-feathered swift strig woman from Meadowfen, Cara is the captain of the village militia. She was responsible for assembling the team of villagers who went out to investigate the black plume of smoke that appeared over Meadowfen’s horizon. She endured a harrowing journey to return home and relay Ashbarrow’s fate to Elder Ardwynn. Cara uses the birdfolk militia stat block adjusted with the racial traits of a swift strig. She is lawful good.

Glide.name: Glide
Glide.description: When falling at least 10 feet, [[lookup @name]] can spend a reaction to fly up to their speed in one direction as they descend. They land in an unoccupied space at the end of their movement, and take no falling damage. They cannot glide while carrying heavy objects, heavy weapons, or shields (though they can drop any held items as part of their reaction).

Studded Leather Armor.name: Studded Leather Armor
Studded Leather Armor.description: Made from tough but flexible leather, studded leather is reinforced with close-set rivets or spikes.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description:
Your sharp claws aid you in unarmed combat and while climbing. Your damage for an unarmed strike is [[/damage average]] damage.

Additionally, you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks made to climb any surface your talons could reasonably grip.

Patterned Feathers.name: Patterned Feathers
Patterned Feathers.description: [[lookup @name]] has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when you attempt to hide in a forest.

Cervan Bandit General.name: Cervan Bandit General
Cervan Bandit General.description: Bandit clans are commanded by generals. Serving as both a battle-tested warrior and master strategist, they alone coordinate the disparate band of thieves and outlaws that make up the collective. While military monikers are used to refer to bandit leadership, more than combat prowess is needed to maintain order in these volatile organizations. A dominating personality and charismatic voice are as necessary as a swift blade and a sharp mind. Cervans don’t typically take to brigandry, but their practical skills and ability to survive in even the most adverse situations make those with loose morals and dubious ambitions a natural fit.

Surge of Vigor.name: Surge of Vigor
Surge of Vigor.description: If an attack deals over half of the general’s current remaining hit points in damage (even if their hit points are reduced to 0 by the attack), they immediately regain [[/heal average]].

Standing Leap.name: Standing Leap
Standing Leap.description: The general’s long jump is 30 feet, and their base high jump is 15 feet, with or without a running start.

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The general makes three melee attacks, two with their [[/item Scimitar]] and one with their [[/item Dagger]]. Alternatively, the general can make two ranged attack with their daggers.

Parry.name: 格挡
Parry.description: 该将军对其可能被命中的一次近战攻击，其护甲等级获得+2加值。该将军必须能看见攻击者并持用一把近战武器。

Studded Leather Armor.name: 镶钉皮甲
Studded Leather Armor.description: 由坚韧而柔韧的皮革制成，镶钉皮甲通过密集排列的铆钉或尖刺进行加固。

Cervan Priest.name: 塞尔文祭司
Cervan Priest.description: 塞凡村落通常由一位社区长老领导，他既精通政治，也熟谙不朽之道。祭司为社区提供{神导术}，确保仪式得到恰当遵守，习俗得以维系。作为村落历史的讲述者与守护者，他们被托付以神话与民间传说，这些故事被用来传授在森林中生存所必需的{知识}。

Charge.name: 冲锋
Charge.description: 如果该祭司沿直线向敌人移动至少20尺，其鹿角攻击将造成额外的[[/damage average]]伤害。若冲锋目标为大型或更小的生物，则必须进行[[/save format=long]]，否则将被推离祭司10尺。

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
该祭司是一名3环施法者。其施法关键属性是感知（法术豁免DC 12，法术攻击命中+4）。祭司准备了以下牧师法术：

戏法（随意）：[[/item .kuFLdlkJoA0TdrXJ]]{神导术}, [[/item .Avr7mAjqoRqt1arz]]{光亮术}, [[/item .PO5rIuoGQevfp4hS]]{维生术}

1环（4法术位）：[[/item .jaOUPJoxrVdE4BNh]]{祝福术}, [[/item .CCMNOTvUj4VNlBTQ]]{疗伤术}, [[/item .dYhmgzrwWCCf7imP]]{光导箭}, [[/item .JJJVH3KTcp4APlGu]]{虔诚护盾}

2环（2法术位）：[[/item .nbC7L6NbKqX1ErSk]]{安定心神}, [[/item .2XOGxmcWx9eCrG2f]]{守护之链}

Quarterstaff.name: 长棍
Quarterstaff.description: [[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]] 或 [[/damage twoHanded average]]（若双手持握）。

Surge of Vigor.name: 活力涌动
Surge of Vigor.description: 如果一次攻击造成的伤害超过将军当前剩余生命值的一半（即使该攻击将其生命值降至0），他们将立即恢复[[/heal average]]。

Guidance.name: 神导术
Guidance.description: 你触碰一个自愿的生物。在法术终止前，目标可以选择在一次属性检定时额外掷一粒 d4，并将所得数值加入检定结果中。它可以在进行属性检定之前或之后掷骰。法术随后即终止。

Light.name: 光亮术
Light.description:
你触碰一个任意维度不超过10尺的物件。直至法术终止前，该物件会散发出20尺半径的明亮光照和额外20尺的微光光照。你可以随意选择光照的颜色。用不透明物完全复盖该物件可以阻挡此光线。如果你再次施展此法或以一个动作解散它，则法术终止。

如果你的目标是敌对生物持有或穿戴的物件，则该生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免以避开此法。

materials.value: 一只萤火虫或发光的苔藓。

Spare the Dying.name: 维生术
Spare the Dying.description: 你触碰一个生命值为0的活体生物。该生物将恢复稳定状态。此法术对亡灵或构装生物无效。

Bless.name: 祝福术
Bless.description:
你在射程内祝福至多三个你选择的生物。每当目标在该法术终止前进行一次攻击检定或豁免时，该目标可以掷一次1d4并将掷骰结果加到该攻击检定或豁免上。

升阶效果。 当你使用2环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比1环高一环，法术就能多以一个生物为目标。

materials.value: 洒下一些圣水

Cure Wounds.name: 疗伤术
Cure Wounds.description:
你所触及的一个生物恢复等同于1d8 + 你的施法关键属性调整值的生命值。该法术对亡灵或构装生物无效。

升阶效果。 当你使用2环或更高法术位施展该法术时，治疗量每比1环高一环就增加1d8。

Guiding Bolt.name: 光导箭
Guiding Bolt.description:
一道闪光射向射程内你指定的一个生物。对目标进行一次远程法术攻击。命中时，目标受到4d6光耀伤害，并且由于目标身上闪烁的神秘微光，在你的下一个回合结束前，下一次对该目标进行的攻击检定具有优势。

升环效应。当你使用2环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比1环高一环，伤害就增加1d6。

Shield of Faith.name: 虔诚护盾
Shield of Faith.description: 一道闪烁的力场出现在射程内一个你选择的生物周围并环绕着它，使其在持续时间内AC获得+2加值。

materials.value: 一张写有少量神圣经文的小型羊皮纸。

Shield of Faith.name: 虔诚护盾
Shield of Faith.description: 目标在持续时间内获得+2的AC加值。

Calm Emotions.name: 安定心神
Calm Emotions.description:
你尝试压制一群人的强烈情绪。以你在射程内选择的一点为中心，20尺半径球状区域内的每个类人生物都必须进行一次魅力豁免；生物可以自愿在这次豁免中失败。如果生物豁免失败，从以下两种效果中选择其一。你可以压制任何导致目标被魅惑或恐慌的效应。当此法術结束时，任何被压制的效应会恢复，只要其持续时间在此期间尚未结束。

或者，你可以使目标对你选择的其原本敌对的生物变得冷漠。如果目标受到攻击或被法术伤害，或者目睹其任何朋友受到伤害，这种冷漠状态就会结束。当此法術结束时，该生物会再次变得敌对，除非DM另有规定。

Warding Bond.name: 守护之链
Warding Bond.description:
该法术护卫一个你触及的自愿生物，并在你与目标之间建立一道神秘连接，直到法术结束。当目标在你60尺范围内时，它在AC和豁免上获得+1加值，并且拥有全部伤害抗性。此外，每当它受到伤害时，你也会受到等量伤害。

若你的生命值降至0，或你与目标相距超过60尺，则法术终止。若对任一相连生物再次施展该法术，效果也会终止。你也可通过一个动作主动解除该法术。

materials.value: 一对价值至少50 gp的白金戒指，你和目标必须在持续时间内佩戴。

Corvum Assassin.name: 科沃姆刺客
Corvum Assassin.description: 合约杀手通常是犯罪组织的成员，可以在林地最大、政治最复杂的栖息地找到他们。他们为有权势的人物服务，这些人缺乏道德顾忌且拥有大量金币。刺客从小接受训练，成为其技艺的致命大师，学习如何在枝干小道上潜行，并隐藏在树冠中，以策划完美的伏击。鸦人凭借其天生的智力和狡诈，成为最优秀的刺客。

Glide.name: 滑翔
Glide.description: 当从至少10尺高处坠落时，该刺客可以消耗一次反应，在下落过程中朝一个方向飞行至多等同于其速度的距离。其移动结束时将降落在一个未被占据的空间，且不会受到坠落伤害。若携带重型物件、重型武器或盾牌，则无法进行滑翔（但可以作为反应的一部分丢弃任何手持物品）。

Talons.name: 利爪
Talons.description: 该刺客在进行力量(运动)检定时,为攀爬其利爪能够合理抓握的任何表面具有优势。

Assassinate.name: 刺杀
Assassinate.description: 在刺客的第一个回合中，它对任何尚未行动的生物进行攻击检定具有优势。刺客对陷入突袭的生物造成的任何命中均为重击。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: 每回合一次，当刺客以武器攻击命中目标且在该攻击检定上具有优势时，或当目标处于刺客一名未失能的盟友5尺范围内且刺客在该攻击检定上不具有劣势时，刺客额外造成10（[[/r 3d6]]）点伤害。

Skulker.name: 潜行者
Skulker.description: 刺客在微光光照或黑暗中进行敏捷（隐匿）检定时具有优势。

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击Multiattack。
Multiattack.description: 该刺客发动两次近战攻击：一次使用其[[/item Shortsword]]，一次使用其[[/item Dagger]]。或该刺客使用其匕首发动两次远程攻击。

Shortsword.name: 短剑
Shortsword.description: [[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]，且目标必须进行一次[[/save constitution 13 format=long]]，豁免失败则受到[[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity100]]伤害，成功则仅受半数伤害。

Dagger.name: 匕首
Dagger.description: [[/attack extended]]。[[/damage extended average]]，且目标必须进行一次[[/save format=long]]，豁免失败时承受[[/damage average activity=dnd5eactivity100]]伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。

Corvum Diviner.name: 鸦预言师
Corvum Diviner.description:
预言师专精于深奥的法术和仪式,这些法术和仪式可用于观察推动世界的命运之线。即使此类预言失败,它们通常也会在此过程中揭示有用的信息。鸦形族珍视一切形式的知识,常常像他人交易货物那样交易秘密,因此许多人都被吸引来修习预言师的艺术。

科瓦克斯·雷文

这只纤细的暮色鸦形族的羽衣类似黑嘴喜鹊。作为艾维姆学院的预言术教授,他卓越的才智常被偏执所阻碍,这是预言师工作的一个不幸副作用。这导致教职人员对他的预测持谨慎态度,并使他在校园里赢得了有点古怪的名声。然而,他聪明能干,在冒险的最后两部分中可能成为队伍的有用盟友。科瓦克斯绝不应参与战斗。

Glide.name: 滑翔
Glide.description: 当从至少10尺高处坠落时,预言师可以消耗一个反应,在坠落过程中朝一个方向飞行最多等于其速度的距离。预言师在其移动结束时降落在一个未占据空间,且不受坠落伤害。预言师在携带重型物品、重型武器或盾牌时无法滑翔(但可以在反应中丢弃手持物品)。

Talons.name: 利爪
Talons.description: 预言师在进行力量(运动)检定时,若试图攀爬其利爪能够合理抓握的任何表面,则具有优势。

Skulker.name: 潜行者
Skulker.description: 预言师在微光光照或黑暗术中进行敏捷（隐匿）检定时具有优势。

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
预言师是一名9级施法者。其施法关键属性是智力（法术豁免DC14，法术攻击命中+6）。预言师准备了以下法术：

戏法（随意）：[[/item .SVZdy24B00YLzJjg]]{火焰箭}，[[/item .BJPWgR6QoNHphwvM]]{光亮术}，[[/item .2UpdvicNteLJtRri]]{法师之手}，[[/item .tUECAmXlBfGFnEIk]]{魔法伎俩}

1环（4法术位）：[[/item .dwmayHhQmXLUqBGl]]{侦测魔法}，[[/item .0yReu4GCHx8AHX5S]]{法师护甲}，[[/item .gR9wesbnxWraPsjw]]{魔法飞弹}，[[/item .pRFK5KzSZReYKuuD]]{护盾术}

2环（3法术位）：[[/item .c1iBAZZkPXj0fmDX]]{卜筮术}，[[/item .CCuVhjok3IA56edF]]{迷踪步}

3环（3法术位）：[[/item .lgdtQvoxiXQo0K1h]]{鹰眼术}，[[/item .nGFc2HX5Zs04TzOZ]]{法术反制}，[[/item .a8dWTOBAISB5fzq3]]{飞行术}

4环（3法术位）：[[/item .833G35LP8pu9ssEq]]{高等隐形术}，[[/item .i6ngr5TURJlSv5ci]]{生物定位术}

5环（1法术位）：[[/item .rpK0CchdcQbBKeXl]]{探知}

Fire Bolt.name: 火焰箭
Fire Bolt.description:
你向射程内的一个生物或物件掷出一团火焰。对目标进行一次远程法术攻击。命中时，目标受到1d10点火焰伤害。被此法术命中的易燃物件若未被穿着或携带，则会着火。

当你达到5环（2d10）、11环（3d10）和17环（4d10）时，该法术的伤害增加1d10。

Light.name: 光亮术
Light.description:
你触碰一个任意维度都不超过10尺的物件。直到法术终止前，该物件会散发出20尺半径的明亮光照和额外20尺的微光光照。该光线的颜色可以依你喜好决定。用不透明物完全复盖该物件会阻挡该光线。如果你再次施展此法或用一个动作解散该法术，则法术终止。

如果你以被敌对生物持有或穿戴的物件为目标，则该生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免以避开该法术。

materials.value: 一只萤火虫或发光的苔藓。

Mage Hand.name: 法师之手
Mage Hand.description:
一只漂浮的幽灵手出现在施法距离内你指定的一点。幽灵手持续存在至法术终止。如果幽灵手距你的距离超过 30 尺，或者当你再次施展了该法术时，则现存的幽灵手消失不见。

你可以在施展该法术时使用幽灵手实施一个行为：你可以操控一个物件，或者打开一扇未上锁的门或容器，或者将一件物品放入或取出一个打开的容器，或者将小瓶中的内容物倾倒出来。

在后续的回合中，以一个魔法动作，你可以控制幽灵手再次实施一个行为。作为那个动作的一部分，你可以令幽灵手移动至多 30 尺。

该幽灵手不能攻击，也不能激活魔法物品或承载超过 10 磅重的物质。

Prestidigitation.name: 魔法伎俩
Prestidigitation.description:
该法术是一个初级施法者用来练习的魔法小伎俩。你在施法距离内创造下列魔法效果中的一种：

  • 你创造一个立即生效的，无害的感观效应，比如一束火花，一阵风，微弱音乐或古怪的臭味。
  • 你立即点燃或熄灭一支蜡烛，一支火把或一小型营火。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的物件变得清洁或肮脏。
  • 你立即使一个不大于 1 立方尺的非活体物质变得冰冷、温暖或对其调味，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在一个物件或一个表面上创造一块色斑，或者一个记号，又或者一个标志，其效应持续 1 小时。
  • 你在你手中创造出一个非魔法的小饰品或一个幻术的图像，其大小不能超过你的手掌大小，它会存在持续至下个你的回合结束为止。

如果你多次施展该法术，则可以同时维持至多三个不同的非即时效应，并且可以用一个动作解散其中一种效应。

Detect Magic.name: 侦测魔法
Detect Magic.description:
在法术持续时间内，你能感知到30尺内的魔法存在。若你以此法感知到魔法，你可以使用动作看到区域内任何带有魔法的可见生物或物件周围泛着微弱的灵光，并且你还能了解到其魔法学派（如果有的话）。

该法术可以穿透大部分障碍，但会被1尺厚的石头、1英寸厚的通用金属、薄铅片、或3尺厚的木头或泥土所阻挡。

Mage Armor.name: 法师护甲
Mage Armor.description: 你触碰一个未穿着护甲的自愿生物，一层防护性的魔法力场将环绕它，直至法术终止。目标的护甲等级基础值变为13 + 其敏捷调整值。若目标穿上护甲，或你以一个动作主动解除法术，则法术终止。

materials.value: 一块鞣制好的皮甲

Mage Armor.name: 法师护甲
Mage Armor.description: 目标的基准AC变为13 + 其敏捷调整值。

Magic Missile.name: 魔法飞弹
Magic Missile.description:
你创造出三枚发光的魔法力场飞镖。每枚飞镖都会命中一个你在射程内能看见且自选的生物。一枚飞镖对其目标造成1d4 + 1点力场伤害。所有飞镖同时命中，你可以引导它们命中单一生物或多个生物。

升环效应。当你使用2环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比1环高一环，法术就会多创造出一枚飞镖。

Shield.name: 护盾术
Shield.description: 一道隐形的魔法力场屏障出现并保护你。直到你的下个回合开始前，你在AC上获得+5加值，包括对抗触发此次攻击的攻击，并且你不会受到来自魔法飞弹的伤害。

activation.condition: 当你被攻击命中或被作为魔法飞弹的目标时执行

Shield.name: 护盾术
Shield.description: 直到你的下个回合开始前，你在AC上获得+5加值，包括针对触发此次攻击的攻击，并且你不会受到来自魔法飞弹的伤害。

Augury.name: 卜筮术
Augury.description:
通过投掷嵌有宝石的木棍、掷出龙类骨骸、摆放华丽的卡牌，或使用其他占卜工具，你会从某个异界存在那里得到一个预兆，它关乎你在接下来30分钟内计划采取的某个特定行动方针的结果。DM从以下可能的预兆中选择一个：

  • 吉，代表好的结果
  • 凶，代表坏的结果
  • 吉凶，代表既有好也有坏的结果
  • 无，代表结果并非特别好或特别坏

该法术不会考虑任何可能改变结果的潜在情况，例如施展了额外法术，或是失去了一个伴日或获得了一个伴日。

如果你在完成下一次长休前两次或更多次施展此法术，则自第二次起，每次施展都有累计25%的几率你会得到一个随机的预兆。DM秘密进行此检定。

materials.value: 特别标记的木棍、骨头或类似的价值至少25 gp的代币。

Misty Step.name: 迷踪步
